result.execSummary:
The defendant James B Seymer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.

*Restitution is set at zero.*
Obtain and maintain employment, school or community service / part-time.

No firearms; weapons.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

No contact with victim, Angeline S., until completion of 5 BIP sessions and agent and victim agree to no violent contact.
No drugs.
No alcohol.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
--AODA at discretion of agent.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Defendant James B Seymer in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant James B Seymer in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Additional statements by: Angeline S. 

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 40 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
   --- AODA at discretion of agent.  
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Angeline S., 
   until completion of 5 BIP sessions and agent 
   and victim agree to no violent contact.    
* Obtain and maintain employment, 
   school or community service / part-time.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-14-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.  mld

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.
-- On 5-4-2015, defendant was subjected to a random drug test, which yielded positive results for the use of a controlled substance.  Defendant provided Justice Point with his prescription for Oxycodone.   mld

Defendant James B Seymer in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #3 and #4, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.  

AS TO COUNTS #1 and #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-14-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Angeline S. or Sarmara J., until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant has provided Justice Point with a prescription for his Oxycodone medication.   mld

Defendant has provided Justice Point with a prescription for his OxyCodone medication.   mld

Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-13-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no with Angeline S. or Carmara J., or the address of 3743 E. Squire Avenue, Cudahy, WI.  Absolute sobriety, no drugs or alcohol and no weapons.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANGELINE S. AND CARMARA J.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant James B Seymer in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant James B Seymer in custody.   Attorney George D Kidd, supervised by David Feiss, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  AS TO COUNT 3:  Motion to dismiss FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
